feed.title: NewsTracker: nintendo
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Nintendo reports profit but no word on new president
entry.summary:
Iwata, president from 2002, was a highly visible spokesman for Nintendo, and many in the game industry mourned the 55-year-old's death, which followed a long illness.

Nintendo had reported a 9.9 billion yen loss for the first quarter of the previous fiscal year.

Foreign exchange gains added 10.8 billion yen to operating income in the quarter, Nintendo said.

entry.title: The Internet flooded with tributes to Nintendo chief
entry.summary: Satoru Iwata, who led Japanese video game company Nintendo Co. through years of growth with its Pokemon and Super Mario franchises, died on the weekend of a bile duct tumor, the company said Monday.

entry.title: The Internet flooded with tributes to Nintendo chief
entry.summary: A shopper walks in front of Nintendo's Super Mario characters at an electronics store in Tokyo, Monday, July 13, 2015.

entry.title: The Internet flooded with tributes to Nintendo chief
entry.summary: The small dolls packed with sensors, which already come in Nintendo characters such as Super Mario and Kirby, are used to play games.

entry.title: The Internet flooded with tributes to Nintendo chief
entry.summary:
TOKYO - Nintendo Co. President Satoru Iwata's death from an illness at 55 is being mourned by game fans around the world.

They're sharing Iwata Mii avatars, creating pictures with farewell messages on the Nintendo drawing game Splatoon and sending Tweets with "ThankYouIwata" hashtags.

A petition is circulating, amassing thousands of signatures, urging Nintendo to create an "amiibo" figurine in the likeness of Iwata.

An illustration showing Nintendo characters weeping around Iwata lying down with his eyes closed on a bed of flowers is going viral on Twitter.

entry.title: Game makers reflect on death of Nintendo's Iwata at age 55
Game makers reflect on death of Nintendo's Iwata at age 55
entry.summary: "Iwata-san's passing affects us all deeply. He was a true visionary who expanded our understanding of the amazing art of video games. We offer our condolences to his family, friends and Nintendo colleagues."

entry.title: Nintendo President Satoru Iwata dies after leading Japan game company through success, woes
entry.summary: Nintendo has repeatedly had to lower prices on gadgets to woo buyers.

entry.title: Nintendo's Iwata who led through successes, woes dies at 55
entry.summary: Nintendo America announced it was suspending social media activity for the day in remembrance of Iwata.

entry.title: Nintendo's Iwata who led through successes, woes dies at 55
Nintendo CEO who broadened video game appeal dies of cancer
entry.summary:
Iwata long resisted investors' calls to move into mobile games for fear of cannibalizing Nintendo's traditional console base.

The company did not announce a replacement but Genyo Takeda, senior managing director and one of the lead developers of Nintendo's Wii console, will lead the committee for Iwata's funeral - a sign he could be taking on the leadership role.

entry.title: Nintendo President Satoru Iwata dies of tumor
entry.summary: Iwata remained a presence in Nintendo promotional materials up until his death.

entry.title: Nintendo President Satoru Iwata dies of tumor
entry.summary: Iwata had been employed at an innovative software company before he was recruited as Nintendo chief.

entry.title: Nintendo CEO's death creates leadership doubts at Japanese gamemaker
entry.summary:
Deutsche Bank analyst Hanjoon Kim said Iwata's death was a loss for Nintendo, particularly as he was leading a new strategy in smartphone gaming.

Kyoto-based Nintendo's shares were up 1.2 percent by midday, compared with a flat broader Tokyo market .TOPX.

He attended the company's annual general meeting on June 26, but his condition suddenly deteriorated in the last few days, Nintendo said.

entry.title: Nintendo chief Satoru Iwata dies
entry.summary: Nintendo pioneered game machines since the 1980s, developing one of the first machines and the hit Game Boy hand-held machine.

entry.title: Nintendo President Satoru Iwata dies of tumor
entry.summary: Iwata had been poised to lead Nintendo through another stage after it recently did an about-face and said it will start making games for smartphones - meaning that Super Mario the plumber will start arriving on cellphones and tablets.

entry.title: Nintendo President Satoru Iwata dies of tumor
entry.summary: FILE - In this Jan. 31, 2013 file photo, Nintendo Co. President Satoru Iwata speaks during a news conference in Tokyo.

entry.title: Nintendo President Satoru Iwata dies of tumor
entry.summary: Nintendo said President Iwata died Saturday, July 11, 2015, of a bile duct tumor in a Kyoto hospital, western Japan.

entry.title: Satoru Iwata, president who oversaw Nintendo's expansion, dead at 55
entry.summary:
Iwata led Nintendo's development into a global company, with its hit Wii home console and DS handheld, and also through its recent woes caused by the popularity of smartphones.

In March, Nintendo announced an alliance with Japanese mobile game company DeNA Co. to develop games for mobile devices.

entry.title: Nintendo CEO Satoru Iwata dead at 55
Nintendo CEO Satoru Iwata dies
entry.summary: Nintendo Co's President and Chief Executive Satoru Iwata attends an interview with Reuters in Tokyo in this file May 8, 2014 photo.

entry.title: Nintendo CEO Satoru Iwata dies
entry.summary:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Japanese videogame maker Nintendo Co Ltd's chief executive and president, Satoru Iwata, died on Saturday due to a growth in his bile duct, the company said.

Iwata had been a director at Kyoto-based Nintendo since 2000, and was appointed president in 2002.

Nintendo's shares were up about 1 percent, in line with the broader Tokyo market.

Presiding over a news conference in May to announce Nintendo's full-year financial results, Iwata had said the company's long-awaited entry into smartphone games would help it double annual operating profit in the year to next March.

entry.title: Nintendo President Satoru Iwata Dies of Cancer
